title: Versant - Wikipedia
snippet: Lazarus explained that Versant will be treated as a holding company and "house of brands"; a larger focus will be placed upon its individual properties rather than Versant being a public-facing brand, and decisions on digital operations (such as streaming) will be left to each network.

title: VERSANT Spin Transaction | Comcast Corporation
snippet: The New Name of the Spin-off Was Revealed as VERSANT, Which Speaks to the Company’s Adaptability and Embraces the Opportunity to Shape a New, Modern Media Company

title: Comcast’s Board Approves Separation of Versant Media Group, Inc. | Comcast Corporation
snippet: Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ: CMCSA) today announced that its Board of Directors (the “Board”) has approved the previously announced separation of a strong portfolio of cable television networks and complementary digital platforms from its remaining businesses, and the creation of an ...

title: Comcast's cable spinoff to be named Versant, picked to emphasize corporate versatility
snippet: Versant, which had been called SpinCo until a permanent name was chosen, will own cable networks including USA, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel. It will also house digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass and ...

title: Versant Corporation - Wikipedia
snippet: In late 2012, after rejecting an offer by UNICOM Systems Inc., Versant Corporation announced it was being acquired by Actian Corporation, the commercial developer of Ingres and Vectorwise.
